meanings.sent1: The child's hands were covered in gloops after playing with the slime.
meanings.sent2: The chef added gloops of honey to the recipe for extra sweetness.
meanings.sent3: The gloop dripped slowly from the popsicle, creating a sticky mess.

meanings.definition: To cover or smear with a thick, sticky substance
meanings.sent1: She decided to gloop the paper with glue before sticking on the glitter.
meanings.sent2: The children giggled as they glooped each other with silly string.
meanings.sent3: The prankster glooped the doorknob with slippery soap, causing a slippery situation.
meanings.sent4: The baker carefully glooped the cake with frosting, creating a delicious masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: The gardener glooped the plant with fertilizer to help it grow strong and healthy.

meanings.definition: A sound made by something wet or sticky
meanings.sent1: The gloop of the mud as we walked through the swamp was squishy.
meanings.sent2: The gloop of the paint being stirred echoed in the art studio.
meanings.sent3: The gloop of the syrup being poured over the pancakes was music to his ears.
meanings.sent4: The gloop of the rain hitting the roof was soothing on a lazy afternoon.
meanings.sent5: The gloop of the glue being squeezed out of the bottle signaled the start of the craft project.
